abstract: General Electric agreed to acquire the oil and gas operations from Vetco International for $1.9 billion, people familiar with the situation said.
snippet: General Electric agreed to acquire the oil and gas operations from Vetco International for $1.9 billion, people familiar with the situation said.
lead_paragraph: General Electric agreed yesterday to acquire the oil and gas operations from Vetco International for $1.9 billion, people familiar with the situation said yesterday. The deal, which is expected to be announced today, is part of G.E.’s efforts to grow its energy business as the industry continues its boom.

headline.main: G.E. in Deal to Buy Oil and Gas Concern
headline.print_headline: G.E. in Deal to Buy Oil and Gas Concern

abstract: General Electric has agreed to buy Vetco Gray, a maker of oil and gas-drilling and production equipment, for $1.9 billion to profit from surging demand for energy exploration. G.E., the world’s second-biggest company by market value, is acquiring Houston-based Vetco from three private equity firms, the 3i Group, Candover Investments  and J.P. Morgan Partners.
lead_paragraph: General Electric has agreed to buy Vetco Gray, a maker of oil and gas-drilling and production equipment, for $1.9 billion to profit from surging demand for energy exploration. G.E., the world’s second-biggest company by market value, is acquiring Houston-based Vetco from three private equity firms, the 3i Group, Candover Investments  and J.P. Morgan Partners.

headline.main: G.E. to Buy Energy Company From Investment Firms
